titleStmt.title: William T. Thompson et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8766

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: We the undersigned Citizens of Brown Co Ohio do hereby respectfully request the Governor of Kentucky to pardon Cornelius Bingaman, who is confined in the Penetentiary at Frankfort Ky.

Names
Wm T Thompson
W D Retterman
John J Saye
E Chaddis
Capt. B. C. Rankin
B M Derstine

Pettn for Pardon of Cornelius Bingaman
Jefferson Cir Ct,
Pardon granted
17th April 1863
J F Robinson
1 yr Penty
(Gen Pardon letter & Money to Prisoner)
Issd April 17. 1863
